title: Broken authentication and invalidated email address leads to account takeover

profile.name: Twitter
profile.about: Twitter helps you create and share ideas and information instantly, without barriers.

vulnerability_information:
Hi, team.
I found a bug in twitter.com
Description and POC:
1) Create a twitter account having email address "abcd@x.com".
2) Now Logout and ask for password reset link. Don't use the password reset link.
3) Login using the same password back and update your email address to "efgh@x.com" and verify the same.
4) Now logout and use the password reset link which was mailed to "abcd@x.com" in step 2.
5) You can see that it is possible to change the password.
Here  the password reset link of "abcd@x.com" which was old email address associated with twitter can be use to change the password of twitter account having  updated email address "efgh@x.com".

Attack scenario:
If victim's previous "abcd@x.com" account was compromised, he decided to updated his twitter email address to "efgh@x.com" but before updating by mistake he asked for password reset link. As a result his twitter account will be compromised by the attacker.

Fix: As soon as new email address is updated all the previous links should also get expired.

If you want further information please let me know.

Thanks and regards.
Mohd Haji

activities.message:
Hi, thank you for the report.

Password reset links have a time-based expiration. We do not plan to make any changes in regards to this report at this time.

Thank you for thinking of Twitter security.

hi @jcollins did u ever read the report?
I said after updating email address the password reset link sent to old email address should get expired. I do agree that u have given time-based expiration. But here scenario is different.
Here attacker can easily change the password of new email address associated with twitter before link is getting expired with the help of link generated by your server to old email address.
As a result twitter account  will account be compromised.
Please have a look at it again.
I strongly suggest you that once an email address is updated at twitter then password reset link generated by your server to old email address  should get expire. An attacker needs hardly of 5 to 10 minutes to change the password, till that time link won't be expiring.

If an attacker has access to a victim's email account, there are many ways they can compromise the victim's Twitter account, along with any other accounts associated with that email. A victim needs to secure their email account before anything else.

In your scenario, the attacker has access to the original email account and the victim changes the email account. But it could easily be the other way around: the victim could still have access to their original email account and the attacker could change the email account to something else. Then the victim would have a chance to reset the password and regain control of their account.

Account security is very important to us and we have to consider all sides of an issue. We are always working towards improving account security in many ways.

Thank you for thinking of Twitter security.

Opening to close as "won't fix". As mentioned above, we do not plan to make these specific changes at this time. We may or may not revisit this in the future as part of our continuing work on account security.
